meta-tags.title: Cauliflower Mac & Cheese Bites Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description:
With this dish, you can reinvent a comfort food classic, making muffin-shaped whole grain veggie bombs and a scrumptious sauce.

Sponsored by LACTAID®. LACTAID® Milk is great for cooking because it is 100% real milk, just without the lactose.

firebase.name: Cauliflower Mac & Cheese Bites Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description:
With this dish, you can reinvent a comfort food classic, making muffin-shaped whole grain veggie bombs and a scrumptious sauce.

Sponsored by LACTAID®. LACTAID® Milk is great for cooking because it is 100% real milk, just without the lactose.

description.text:
With this dish, you can reinvent a comfort food classic, making muffin-shaped whole grain veggie bombs and a scrumptious sauce.

Sponsored by LACTAID®. LACTAID® Milk is great for cooking because it is 100% real milk, just without the lactose.

preparationSteps: An introduction to Cauliflower Mac & Cheese Bites with Chef Joel, Cookie Monster, and Elmo (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with muffin liners. Set aside. Cook the pasta al dente according to package instructions. When done, strain through a colander, reserving about 1/2 cup of the pasta water for later. Run the cooked pasta under cold water, then transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Add the olive oil to a large saucepan and set over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring or whisking constantly, until it is completely combined with the oil and starts to smell toasty. Carefully add one third of the milk and whisk well to combine and remove any lumps. Repeat with another third of the milk, and once the mixture is totally smooth, add the remaining third of milk and whisk to combine. Add the salt, garlic powder, and turmeric, and whisk to incorporate. Continue to cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture is totally smooth and thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.

Turn the heat off under the sauce. Add the cheddar cheese and stir or whisk until smooth and combined. If the sauce is too thick, thin it by adding small amounts of the reserved pasta water. Add the cauliflower, cooked pasta, and the egg and stir into the sauce until everything is well combined and evenly coated.

Using an ice cream scoop or large spoon, portion the mac and cheese into the lined muffin cups, filling them just to the top of the liners. Use spoons to top each mac and cheese bite with some of the optional toppings, customizing them as desired. Sprinkle some of the extra shredded cheddar over the top of each bite, and add a small sprinkle of chives. Bake the mac and cheese bites on middle rack of oven until they are golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Check to see that mac and cheese bites are done. Remove from oven, or add time as needed.
Let the mac and cheese bites cool in the pan for 5 minutes before serving.

meta-tags.description: When making dressing from scratch, the knife prep is what takes the most time. When you do it with your [KitchenAid® K400 Blender](https://yummly.app.link/riAWRIPkd1), however, prep almost goes away and clean up is a snap. Plus, the flavors of this Asian-inspired dressing are perfect for everything from a simple green salad, to a dressing for rice noodles, or even for basting grilled meats in before serving.

description.text: When making dressing from scratch, the knife prep is what takes the most time. When you do it with your [KitchenAid® K400 Blender](https://yummly.app.link/riAWRIPkd1), however, prep almost goes away and clean up is a snap. Plus, the flavors of this Asian-inspired dressing are perfect for everything from a simple green salad, to a dressing for rice noodles, or even for basting grilled meats in before serving.

preparationSteps: Add the lime juice, soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, honey, fish sauce, ginger and garlic to your KitchenAid® K400 Blender. Turn the blender to ice crush and allow to run through the cycle. Open the lid cap and add the quartered shallot and half of the grapeseed oil. Replace the lid cap and pulse four times. Open the lid cap again and add the remaining grapeseed oil. Replace the lid cap and pulse another four times.
Store in an airtight container with a tight fitting lid, and shake well before serving.

meta-tags.title: Asian Sesame Roasted Broccoli Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Slightly salty, slightly sweet, this soy and sesame roasted broccoli is addictive! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Asian Sesame Roasted Broccoli Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Slightly salty, slightly sweet, this soy and sesame roasted broccoli is addictive! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: Slightly salty, slightly sweet, this soy and sesame roasted broccoli is addictive! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

Make sure the broccoli florets are roughly 1 inch wide, and place them in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle with the tamari, sesame oil, brown sugar, and crushed red pepper (if using). Toss until the florets are evenly coated.
Arrange the broccoli florets in an even layer on the baking sheet.
Roast on middle rack of oven, stirring halfway through the cook time, until broccoli is crisp-tender and slightly charred, 22-25 minutes.
Check to see that broccoli is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Sprinkle the florets with sesame seeds, and serve immediately.

meta-tags.title: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Place the tamari, brown sugar, honey, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Seal the bag and shake vigorously to combine.
Add the smashed garlic, chopped ginger, and chicken legs to the bag. Seal bag and gently shake to thoroughly coat chicken in marinade.
Transfer the chicken legs to refrigerator to marinate for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spray with nonstick cooking spray, and set aside.
Using tongs, arrange the chicken legs on the baking sheet, allowing excess marinade to drip off into the bag.
Roast the chicken legs on middle rack of oven until slightly brown, 20-30 minutes.
Set oven to broil. Broil the chicken until skin is caramelized and chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165°F, 3-5 minutes. Keep a close eye on chicken to ensure it does not burn.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Transfer chicken legs to a plate and sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped scallions, if desired. Serve immediately.

meta-tags.title: Instant Pot Asian-Inspired Pork Shoulder Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description:
This Instant Pot recipe for tender pork butt comes from Daniel Shumski, author of the cookbook "[How to Instant Pot: Mastering All the Functions of the One Pot That Will Change the Way You Cook](https://www.howtoinstantpot.com/)." In this easy pork recipe, you'll take advantage of store-bought sauce and, of course, the electric pressure cooker to get your main course prepared in 10 minutes flat (hello, weeknight meal!). Using an electric pressure cooker helps bring the cook time for the pork shoulder down to 45 minutes — a far cry from the usual 3-4 hour cooking time of your average pulled pork recipe. 
 
This simple pressure cooker recipe is a great starter recipe for first-time Instant Pot users, as it requires minimal prep and leaves you plenty of room to make the recipe your own: choose a gluten-free sauce (check that it contains tamari instead of soy sauce), swap out the chives for green onions, serve mixed with Chinese vegetables sauteed in sesame oil for a low-carb meal, stir pork chunks into soup, or spoon over brown rice for a hearty rice bowl ... use your imagination to customize it to your own tastes and dietary needs. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Daniel Shumski](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Daniel%20Shumski).
 
**Cooking Tip:** After the pork is done cooking, place any extra cooking liquid left in the pot in the refrigerator overnight. Remove and discard the fat that solidifies atop the cooking liquid and use the remaining liquid as a broth for serving udon noodles or to season a stove top stir-fry. (It's particularly good for adding a punch of umami to vegetable and tofu stir-fries.) The liquid can be placed in a zip-top bag and frozen for up to three months.

preparationSteps: Place the onions in the inner pot, sprinkle the salt and pepper over them, and add the water.
Place the pork on top of the onions and drizzle it with the sauce.
Close and lock the lid. Set the valve to Sealing. Press Cancel, then press Manual or Pressure Cook and use the Pressure or Pressure Level button to select High Pressure. Set the time to 45 minutes.

When the cooking cycle ends, press Cancel. Allow the appliance to cool and pressure release naturally, about 20 minutes. (The pressure is released when the small metal float valve next to the pressure-release valve sinks back into the lid and the lid is no longer locked.)
Remove the lid. Use tongs to remove the pork from the inner pot and serve it with the sauce drizzled over it, accompanied by rice and garnished with sesame seeds and chopped chives.

meta-tags.title: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a roasting rack on top. Cover the rack with another sheet of foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Use a knife to poke holes all over the foil.
Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels. Place the chicken wings in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Sprinkle in the baking powder. Seal the bag and shake until the wings are evenly coated.
Drizzle the canola oil into the bag of chicken wings. Seal the bag and shake again to coat the chicken wings in oil.
Arrange the chicken wings on the foil-covered roasting rack.
Bake the chicken wings on middle rack of oven until browned and crispy, 45-50 minutes. While the wings bake, make the sauce.
Place the water, soy sauce, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, fish sauce, and toasted sesame oil in a small saucepan. Grate or press the garlic and ginger into the pan.

Set the pan over medium heat and bring to a low boil. Allow the mixture to bubble, whisking occasionally, until it is reduced to about 1/2 cup, 5-7 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside. The sauce will thicken slightly as it cools.
Finely chop the scallion.
Check to see that chicken wings are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed. Drizzle the sauce liberally over the hot chicken wings, reserving about half for serving.
Transfer the wings to a serving plate. Garnish with scallions, and serve immediately with the reserved sauce on the side.

meta-tags.title: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Place the tamari, brown sugar, honey, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Seal the bag and shake vigorously to combine.
Add the smashed garlic, chopped ginger, and chicken legs to the bag. Seal bag and gently shake to thoroughly coat chicken in marinade.
Transfer the chicken legs to refrigerator to marinate for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spray with nonstick cooking spray, and set aside.
Using tongs, arrange the chicken legs on the baking sheet, allowing excess marinade to drip off into the bag.
Roast the chicken legs on middle rack of oven until slightly brown, 20-30 minutes.
Set oven to broil. Broil the chicken until skin is caramelized and chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165°F, 3-5 minutes. Keep a close eye on chicken to ensure it does not burn.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Transfer chicken legs to a plate and sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped scallions, if desired. Serve immediately.

meta-tags.title: Instant Pot Asian-Inspired Pork Shoulder Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description:
This Instant Pot recipe for tender pork butt comes from Daniel Shumski, author of the cookbook "[How to Instant Pot: Mastering All the Functions of the One Pot That Will Change the Way You Cook](https://www.howtoinstantpot.com/)." In this easy pork recipe, you'll take advantage of store-bought sauce and, of course, the electric pressure cooker to get your main course prepared in 10 minutes flat (hello, weeknight meal!). Using an electric pressure cooker helps bring the cook time for the pork shoulder down to 45 minutes — a far cry from the usual 3-4 hour cooking time of your average pulled pork recipe. 
 
This simple pressure cooker recipe is a great starter recipe for first-time Instant Pot users, as it requires minimal prep and leaves you plenty of room to make the recipe your own: choose a gluten-free sauce (check that it contains tamari instead of soy sauce), swap out the chives for green onions, serve mixed with Chinese vegetables sauteed in sesame oil for a low-carb meal, stir pork chunks into soup, or spoon over brown rice for a hearty rice bowl ... use your imagination to customize it to your own tastes and dietary needs. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Daniel Shumski](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Daniel%20Shumski).
 
**Cooking Tip:** After the pork is done cooking, place any extra cooking liquid left in the pot in the refrigerator overnight. Remove and discard the fat that solidifies atop the cooking liquid and use the remaining liquid as a broth for serving udon noodles or to season a stove top stir-fry. (It's particularly good for adding a punch of umami to vegetable and tofu stir-fries.) The liquid can be placed in a zip-top bag and frozen for up to three months.

preparationSteps: Place the onions in the inner pot, sprinkle the salt and pepper over them, and add the water.
Place the pork on top of the onions and drizzle it with the sauce.
Close and lock the lid. Set the valve to Sealing. Press Cancel, then press Manual or Pressure Cook and use the Pressure or Pressure Level button to select High Pressure. Set the time to 45 minutes.

When the cooking cycle ends, press Cancel. Allow the appliance to cool and pressure release naturally, about 20 minutes. (The pressure is released when the small metal float valve next to the pressure-release valve sinks back into the lid and the lid is no longer locked.)
Remove the lid. Use tongs to remove the pork from the inner pot and serve it with the sauce drizzled over it, accompanied by rice and garnished with sesame seeds and chopped chives.

meta-tags.title: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a roasting rack on top. Cover the rack with another sheet of foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Use a knife to poke holes all over the foil.
Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels. Place the chicken wings in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Sprinkle in the baking powder. Seal the bag and shake until the wings are evenly coated.
Drizzle the canola oil into the bag of chicken wings. Seal the bag and shake again to coat the chicken wings in oil.
Arrange the chicken wings on the foil-covered roasting rack.
Bake the chicken wings on middle rack of oven until browned and crispy, 45-50 minutes. While the wings bake, make the sauce.
Place the water, soy sauce, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, fish sauce, and toasted sesame oil in a small saucepan. Grate or press the garlic and ginger into the pan.

Set the pan over medium heat and bring to a low boil. Allow the mixture to bubble, whisking occasionally, until it is reduced to about 1/2 cup, 5-7 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside. The sauce will thicken slightly as it cools.
Finely chop the scallion.
Check to see that chicken wings are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed. Drizzle the sauce liberally over the hot chicken wings, reserving about half for serving.
Transfer the wings to a serving plate. Garnish with scallions, and serve immediately with the reserved sauce on the side.

description.text: Sprinkles, graham crackers, and ice cream mingling with honey, strawberries, and cinna-nom-nom? It’s a party for your palate! Enjoy the leftovers for a month, unless Cookie Monster finds them.   Sponsored by LACTAID®. LACTAID® Milk is 100% real milk, just without the lactose, so you can enjoy the delicious taste of milk, without the discomfort.

preparationSteps: An introduction to Confetti Ice Cream Sandwiches with Cookie Monster and Chef Joel (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)
Preheat the oven to 300°F. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper.

Place the whole wheat flour, kosher salt, cinnamon, and baking powder in a large mixing bowl and whisk to combine. Place the honey, oil, vanilla, egg, and skim milk in a small mixing bowl and whisk until the egg is fully combined with the other ingredients. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until the mixture just starts to come together. Using your hands, knead the dough until it comes together and forms a ball. Divide the dough in half and shape into balls.

Place a sheet of parchment from one of the prepared baking sheets on a work surface. Place a dough ball in the center, and top with a second piece of parchment paper. Roll the dough between the sheets of paper into a rectangle that is about 1/4-inch thick. Remove the top piece of parchment and carefully transfer the bottom parchment with the dough to a baking sheet. Repeat rolling with the second ball of dough, making sure it is the same size as the first. Bake the cookie dough on middle rack of oven until lightly brown around the edges, 25-30 minutes.

Scoop a container of vanilla ice cream into a large mixing bowl and let sit at room temperature until it starts to soften, about 10 minutes. Once softened, add the sprinkles and stir to incorporate them into the ice cream. Place the ice cream back in the freezer to stay cold while the cookies finish baking and cooling.

Check to see that the cookies are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed. When done, transfer the baking sheets to a wire rack and let the cookies cool completely before using. Once the cookies are cool, remove the ice cream from the freezer and spread it into an even layer over one of the cookie layers, making sure to take it all the way to the edges. Arrange the sliced strawberries over the ice cream. Top with the second cookie layer and press it down lightly. Transfer the baking sheet to the freezer to firm up the ice cream, about 15 minutes.

Remove the baking sheet from the freezer and transfer the ice cream sandwich to a cutting board. Using a serrated knife, cut the large sandwich into 2x2-inch squares. Serve the ice cream sandwiches immediately, or wrap individually in plastic wrap and store in the freezer for up to one month.

description.text: Chef Joel's heart beets for these healthy treats! This hearty breakfast’s staple ingredients come as no surprise. Making this recipe your own is a batter of fruitful ex-berry-mentation.   Sponsored by LACTAID®. preparationSteps: An introduction to Red Velvet Heart Pancakes with Elmo, Cookie Monster, and Chef Joel (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)

Place the mashed beets and 1 cup of the milk in a blender and blend on high until completely smooth. Pour the mixture into a large mixing bowl and add the remaining 1 cup of milk, the honey, eggs, oil, and vanilla. Whisk well to combine.
In a medium mixing bowl combine the flours, baking powder, and salt.

Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and whisk until just combined (it's ok if there are still a few small lumps). Carefully transfer the batter to a squeeze bottle, a piping bag, or large zip-top bag. If using a bag, snip about 1/4-inch from the tip for piping.

Heat a large nonstick skillet or electric griddle on medium to medium-high heat. Once hot, dip a small wad of paper towel into some oil and spread a light layer over the pan or griddle. Use the squeeze bottle to draw heart-shaped pancakes onto the griddle, making sure to fill them in completely. Once the pancakes begin to form small bubbles on top, about 4 minutes, carefully flip them over. Continue cooking until lightly brown, 2-3 minutes.
Transfer the pancakes to serving plates. Serve with warm maple syrup, fresh berries, and powdered sugar as desired.

meta-tags.title: Easy All-Butter Pie Crust Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: If you’re looking for exceptional flavor in a homemade pie crust, it’s got to be all-butter. While an all-butter crust has a reputation for being tricky, this two-crust recipe has several tricks for achieving the ultimate flaky texture as well as great flavor. Start with frozen butter (plan at least 3 hours to freeze it solid) and grate it rather than cube it so you're less likely to overwork the dough. Use ice-cold water. Minimize handling by working quickly and gently folding the dough with a rubber spatula. For a pretty presentation, before baking you can brush the top and edges of a double-crust pie crust with an egg wash of 1 large egg yolk whisked together with 2 teaspoons whole milk. It’ll create a gorgeous golden hue sure to impress. The dough will keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for up to 3 months. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

description.text: If you’re looking for exceptional flavor in a homemade pie crust, it’s got to be all-butter. While an all-butter crust has a reputation for being tricky, this two-crust recipe has several tricks for achieving the ultimate flaky texture as well as great flavor. Start with frozen butter (plan at least 3 hours to freeze it solid) and grate it rather than cube it so you're less likely to overwork the dough. Use ice-cold water. Minimize handling by working quickly and gently folding the dough with a rubber spatula. For a pretty presentation, before baking you can brush the top and edges of a double-crust pie crust with an egg wash of 1 large egg yolk whisked together with 2 teaspoons whole milk. It’ll create a gorgeous golden hue sure to impress. The dough will keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for up to 3 months. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

preparationSteps: In a large bowl, combine 2 1/2 cups flour and the salt. Using the large holes of a box grater, grate frozen butter onto a plate, emptying grater occasionally if needed. Or shred butter in a food processor fitted with a cold, coarse shredding disc.
Add butter to flour and toss with your fingers to coat completely.

Make a well in the center of the mixture and, gently folding with a rubber spatula, gradually add ice-cold water, beginning with 1/2 cup and adding additional water if needed until dough holds together without being sticky.
Divide the dough into 2 discs, each about 1 inch thick. Wrap each in plastic wrap or waxed paper and refrigerate 15-30 minutes.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out 1 disc into an 11-inch circle. Gently roll dough onto  a rolling pin and then unroll over a 9-inch pie plate. Fit the dough into the pie plate, easing it into the inside edge without stretching.

For a single-crust pie, if needed, trim edge of dough with a paring knife or kitchen scissors to an even 1-inch overhang. Fold overhang under so it’s even with the edge of the pie plate. Crimp edge of dough (pinch it gently with the thumb and index finger on one hand and press the dough in the space between those two fingers with the index finger on the other hand; repeat to crimp the entire edge). Refrigerate crust until ready to fill. Repeat to make a second single-crust pie. Fill and bake crusts as your pie recipe directs.

For a double-crust pie, arrange first dough disc in pie plate as directed in Step 6 and trim, but don’t crimp the edge; refrigerate. Roll second disc into a 10-inch circle, place on a large baking sheet, and refrigerate. Fill crust in pie plate as your pie recipe directs. Gently roll dough from baking sheet onto  a rolling pin and then unroll over filled crust. Trim both edges of pastry to an even 1-inch overhang. Fold dough under so it’s even with the edge of the pie plate. Crimp edge as directed in step 5, and bake as your pie recipe directs.
